means: 笛卡尔（法国哲学家、数学家，1596-1690）

sentence.Network_en: Descartes received his stimulus from the new physics and astronomy of Copernicus, Galileo, and others.
sentence.Network_cn: 笛卡儿从哥白尼、伽利略等人的新物理学和天文学中得到启发。

sentence.Network_en: Descartes has an exceptional record in both the academic and sporting fields.
sentence.Network_cn: 笛卡尔学校在学术和运动领域异常地保持着纪录.

sentence.Network_en: Descartes raises the central questions of modem philosophy.
sentence.Network_cn: 笛卡尔提出了现代哲学的核心问题.

means.word_mean: 1. French philosopher and mathematician; developed dualistic theory of mind and matter; introduced the use of coordinates to locate a point in two or three dimensions (1596-1650)
